abstract: AT&T has agreed to buy DirecTV for $48.5 billion. | AstraZeneca has rejected Pfizer’s “final” offer. | Google may buy the video game service Twitch. | Deutsche Bank plans to raise fresh capital.
snippet: AT&T has agreed to buy DirecTV for $48.5 billion. | AstraZeneca has rejected Pfizer’s “final” offer. | Google may buy the video game service Twitch. | Deutsche Bank plans to raise fresh capital.
lead_paragraph: AT&T agreed on Sunday to buy the satellite television operator DirecTV for $48.5 billion in a bid to “tilt the balance of power with media companies as the market for broadband Internet and video shifts,” Michael J. de la Merced and David Gelles write in DealBook. With the acquisition, AT&T becomes the latest telecommunications giant seeking to establish an even greater reach.
